content.description: Funny name, great climb!  Locate the bolt about 7 off the ground on the arête on the right side of the face.  Follow the arête, placing gear and passing two more bolts.  Bear left at the ledge to join the anchor at the top of Advanced Geir.

Start on the far left side of the wall beneath a bolt and obvious flake. Climb up past the bolt to reach the flake. Continue up the flake and the face above. Clip a 2nd bolt and move slightly right and up to the anchor.
content.protection: Gear to gold Camalot and stoppers; 2 bolts. Shares anchors with Advanced Geir/Pigtails & Powerdrills.

content.description:
This climb has tricky but solid gear.  Like most LDE climbs, it was established ground-up; one bolt was drilled from a hook placement during this ascent. 

  Later, we had a trusted friend check out Advanced Geir before posting it up.  Following his recommendation, two more bolts were added to back off the commitment level a bit.  Even with its moderate grade and the addition of these bolts, it's still a climb for a seasoned trad climber. 

  Look for a bolt about 10 off the ground in the middle of the face just left of where the hand line protecting the approach ends. 

  1) Stem the start of the climb to reach the first bolt.  Continue straight up the face making tricky gear placements.  Clip a second bolt & pull through the crux.  For extra credit find the good gear nearby the third bolt.  Move up to the comfortable ledge.  (5.9, 90'). 

  2) Move left to a crack with a small bulge.  Pull the bulge (5.9) and move a few feet right to a second crack that forms a ramp.  Follow the ramp up and step right to the summit.  (5.9, 70') 

  Descent:  Rappel the route.

Great, fun climbing on a mixture of face and crack on the north side of the formation.  Climb 30 up a corner / crack system on the right side of the face.  Traverse a few feet left to 5 bolts heading up the face 60 to a second crack system.  Follow the cracks system until it widens to a chimney.  Place some gear and pull the bulge on your right to the top. 

  Descent: Two single line rappels. First rap - 60 feet to the chimney climbers left of the route. Second rap - 100 feet to start of route.

Time to get schooled on great mixed lines!  The trail leading to the Climbology area first leads to Accelerated Climbology.  To approach Advanced Geir and Pigtails and Powerdrills, hike up from Accelerated Climbology and locate the hand rope protecting the sketchy stuff.  Follow the hand rope up and right along exposed terrain.  The rope ends at the base of the rock between Pigtails and Powerdrills (right) and Advanced Geir (left).
